alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 12:23AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Brown, southeastern Coleman, eastern McCulloch and San Saba Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1222 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms over southern Brown County, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Brady, San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Sloan, Zephyr, Brookesmith, Skeeterville, Voca, Chappel, Elm Grove, Winchell, Camp San Saba, Rochelle, Camp Bowie, Trickham, Placid and Mercury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west central Texas.
